Package connections

Class ConnectionSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • connections.ConnectionSettings
  • public class ConnectionSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to represent settings for a connection.

      • UNDEFINED

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionSettings

        public ConnectionSettings​(int headerTableSize,
                          int enablePush,
                          int maxConcurrentStreams,
                          int initialWindowSize,
                          int maxFrameSize,
                          int maxHeaderListSize)
        Creates settings with the specified values.
        Parameters:
        headerTableSize - Allows the sender to inform the remote endpoint of the maximum size of the header compression table used to decode header blocks, in octets.
        enablePush - This setting can be used to disable server push. An endpoint MUST NOT send a PUSH_PROMISE frame if it receives this parameter set to a value of 0.
        maxConcurrentStreams - Indicates the maximum number of concurrent streams that the sender will allow.
        initialWindowSize - Indicates the sender's initial window size (in octets) for stream-level flow control.
        maxFrameSize - Indicates the size of the largest frame payload that the sender is willing to receive, in octets.
        maxHeaderListSize - This advisory setting informs a peer of the maximum size of header list that the sender is prepared to accept, in octets.

    • Method Detail

      • setSettings

        public void setSettings​(ConnectionSettings newSettings)
        Changes all the settings to new settings, unless the new setting is undefined.
        Parameters:
        newSettings - the new settings to use.

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • values
